name: Karen Lee's Charred Sesame Pheasant
keywords: appetizer, boneless pheasant breast, brewed tea, chili oil, dark soy sauce, garlic, poultry, red wine vinegar, scallion, sesame oil, sesame paste, watercress
recipeIngredient: Boneless breasts of two 2 1/2-pound pheasants (See note)

recipeInstructions.text: Place the pheasant breasts in a bowl. Place the garlic cloves through the feed tube of a running food processor, then add the remaining ingredients except the scallions and watercress. Process until smooth. Stir in the scallions. Pour this mixture over the pheasant breasts, cover, refrigerate and marinate overnight.
Preheat the grill or broiler. Cook the pheasant breasts about five minutes on each side, until just cooked through. Do not overcook. Allow to cool.

Arrange watercress on a platter. Cut the pheasant into bite-size pieces about 1-inch square and thread on short bamboo skewers or picks. Arrange the skewers on the watercress and serve as an hors d'hoeuvre.
